feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 2:55PM AKST until November 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PASSING FRONT TO BRING SNOW TO NORTHERN LYNN CANAL... .Northerly winds ahead of a gale force front will bring in below freezing to near freezing temperatures to the northern panhandle tonight and Wednesday. Wednesday afternoon, a front will bring moisture to the panhandle that will last into Thursday. As this moisture collides with the cold air in the north, snow is likely.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 1:59PM AKST until November 29 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches in most areas, with up to 6 inches along the Nulato Hills. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. There is a

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 1:59PM AKST until November 29 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow, with low visibility possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. There is a chance of freezing rain this afternoon as well.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued November 28 at 1:59PM AKST until November 29 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches, with up to 7 inches along the Nulato Hills and near Kaltag. Winds gusting to 30 mph with blowing snow and visibility one half mile or less at times.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 1:59PM AKST until November 29 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting to 35 mph. * WHERE...Lower Koyukuk Valley.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 1:59PM AKST until November 29 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk Valleys.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 1:54PM AKST until November 29 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 4:40AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG AND GUSTY SOUTHEAST WINDS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... Gusty southeast winds will affect a large portion of Southcentral today, from the Kenai Peninsula to Anchorage, the Matanuska Valley, and the southern to western Susitna Valley. Winds will gradually increase this morning, then peak this afternoon and evening. Winds will then diminish overnight tonight through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
